title: Build Automatic Question Paper Generation System

requirements.text: Implement teacher authentication system with Internet Identity integration for login/logout functionality
acceptanceCriteria: Teacher can log in using Internet Identity
Teacher can log out from the navigation sidebar
Authentication state persists across page refreshes
Unauthenticated users are redirected to login page

requirements.text: Create Teacher Login page with college logo placeholder, system title 'Automatic Question Paper Generation System', Internet Identity login button, and forgot password link

quotes: Title: Automatic Question Paper Generation System

acceptanceCriteria: Page displays college logo at top center
System title is prominently displayed
Internet Identity login button is clearly visible
Forgot password link is present and styled appropriately
Page uses navy blue, light blue, white, and light grey color scheme

requirements.text: Build Dashboard page with welcome message showing teacher name, navigation sidebar with links to Dashboard, Add Questions, Question Bank, Generate Paper, Generated Papers, and Logout

quotes: Navigation sidebar with: Dashboard, Add Questions, Question Bank, Generate Paper, Generated Papers, Logout

acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard displays personalized welcome message with teacher's name
Navigation sidebar is fixed and accessible from all pages
All navigation links route to correct pages
Logout option triggers authentication logout
Sidebar uses minimal academic icons for each menu item

requirements.text: Display statistics cards on Dashboard showing Total Subjects, Total Questions, and Papers Generated with real-time counts from database

quotes: Cards showing: Total Subjects, Total Questions, Papers Generated

acceptanceCriteria: Three cards display accurate counts from backend
Each card has an appropriate icon
Cards use rounded corners and subtle shadows
Counts update when data changes

requirements.text: Implement database structure visualization on Dashboard showing the workflow: Subjects → Question Categories → Stored Questions → Paper Generation Engine → PDF Output

quotes: Include database structure visualization in dashboard showing: Subjects → Question Categories → Stored Questions → Paper Generation Engine → PDF Output

acceptanceCriteria: Visual flowchart displays the five stages clearly
Uses arrows or connectors between stages
Styled consistently with academic theme
Provides clear understanding of system architecture

requirements.text: Create backend data model for Subjects with fields: id, name, code, and ability to add, edit, and delete subjects

quotes: i want engineering subjects like discrete mathematics,operating system,microprocessor etc etc
provide acess to change or edit or add subjects

acceptanceCriteria: Subject type includes id, name, and code fields
CRUD operations (create, read, update, delete) are available for subjects
Default subjects include Discrete Mathematics, Operating System, and Microprocessor
Subject list is persisted in stable storage

requirements.text: Create backend data model for Questions with fields: id, subjectId, category (2 Marks, 4 Marks, MCQ, 6 Marks, 8 Marks), questionText, options (array for MCQ), correctAnswer (for MCQ), difficultyLevel (Easy, Medium, Hard), and timestamp

quotes: Question Category dropdown (2 Marks, 4 Marks, MCQ, 6 Marks, 8 Marks)
Option fields (visible only if MCQ selected)

acceptanceCriteria: Question type includes all specified fields
Category is restricted to: 2 Marks, 4 Marks, MCQ, 6 Marks, 8 Marks
Difficulty level is restricted to: Easy, Medium, Hard
Options and correctAnswer are stored only for MCQ type questions
Questions are persisted in stable storage

requirements.text: Build Add Questions page with form containing subject dropdown, question category dropdown, question text area, MCQ options fields (visible only when MCQ is selected), difficulty level dropdown, and Save to Database button with success message popup

quotes: Add Questions Page (Database Connected Form UI)
Option fields (visible only if MCQ selected)

acceptanceCriteria: Form displays all required input fields
Subject dropdown populates from database subjects
Category dropdown shows: 2 Marks, 4 Marks, MCQ, 6 Marks, 8 Marks
Four option fields and correct answer selector appear only when MCQ is selected
Difficulty dropdown shows: Easy, Medium, Hard
Save button validates inputs and saves question to backend
Success popup appears after successful save
Form resets after successful submission

requirements.text: Create Question Bank page with ability to view all questions grouped by subject and category, and provide edit and delete functionality for both subjects and questions

quotes: provide acess to change or edit or add subjects and questions in it

acceptanceCriteria: Question Bank displays all questions organized by subject
Questions are further grouped by category (2m, 4m, MCQ, 6m, 8m)
Each question has edit and delete buttons
Edit button opens modal or form to modify question details
Delete button prompts confirmation before removing question
Subject management section allows adding, editing, and deleting subjects
Changes are persisted to backend immediately

requirements.text: Build Generate Question Paper page with form containing subject dropdown, exam duration input, total marks input, and number of questions selector for each category (2 Marks, 4 Marks, MCQ, 6 Marks, 8 Marks), plus Generate Paper button that triggers database-based automatic question selection

quotes: Select number of questions from each category (2m, 4m, MCQ, 6m, 8m)
System should show database-based automatic selection concept

acceptanceCriteria: Form displays subject dropdown populated from database
Exam duration field accepts time in minutes
Total marks field validates numeric input
Individual count inputs for each question category (2m, 4m, MCQ, 6m, 8m)
Generate Paper button validates that requested questions exist in database
Backend randomly selects questions from database based on criteria
System ensures no duplicate questions in generated paper
Generated paper is saved with unique ID and timestamp

requirements.text: Create backend data model for GeneratedPapers with fields: id, subjectId, subjectName, examDuration, totalMarks, questions (array of question IDs grouped by section), setVariants (5 variants: A, B, C, D, E with shuffled question order), createdAt, and teacherId

quotes: Generate 5 Different PDF Sets (Set A, Set B, Set C, Set D, Set E)

acceptanceCriteria: GeneratedPaper type includes all specified fields
Questions are stored grouped by section (A: MCQ, B: 2m/4m, C: 6m/8m)
Five set variants (A-E) are generated with shuffled question order
Each variant maintains section structure but randomizes order within sections
Papers are associated with the teacher who created them
Papers are persisted in stable storage

requirements.text: Build Generated Question Paper Preview page with formal academic layout including college name header, subject name, time and total marks, questions organized in Section A (MCQ), Section B (2 Marks & 4 Marks), Section C (6 Marks & 8 Marks) with proper numbering, and Download PDF button for each of 5 sets (A, B, C, D, E)

quotes: Generate 5 Different PDF Sets (Set A, Set B, Set C, Set D, Set E)

acceptanceCriteria: Preview page displays college name at top
Subject name, exam duration, and total marks are clearly shown
Questions are organized into three labeled sections
Section A shows MCQ questions with options
Section B shows 2 Marks and 4 Marks questions
Section C shows 6 Marks and 8 Marks questions
Questions are numbered sequentially within each section
Five tabs or buttons allow switching between Set A, B, C, D, E
Each set displays different question order while maintaining structure
Download PDF button is available for each set

requirements.text: Implement PDF generation functionality that creates downloadable PDFs of generated question papers maintaining formal academic formatting with college header, sections, and proper numbering

quotes: Generate 5 Different PDF Sets (Set A, Set B, Set C, Set D, Set E)

acceptanceCriteria: PDF generation uses client-side library (e.g., jsPDF or react-pdf)
Generated PDF includes college name, subject, time, and marks
PDF maintains section structure (A, B, C) with proper formatting
Questions are numbered correctly in PDF
MCQ options are displayed clearly in PDF
Each set (A-E) generates a unique PDF file
PDF filename includes subject name, set variant, and timestamp

requirements.text: Create Generated Papers page that lists all previously generated question papers with details (subject, date, marks) and allows accessing preview and PDF download for each paper
acceptanceCriteria: Page displays list of all generated papers for logged-in teacher
Each paper entry shows subject name, creation date, and total marks
View button opens the preview page for that paper
Papers are sorted by creation date (newest first)
Empty state message displays when no papers have been generated

requirements.text: Apply consistent navy blue, light blue, white, and light grey color palette across all pages with Poppins or Inter font, rounded buttons with subtle shadows, soft shadows on cards, and responsive grid layout

quotes: academic theme (blue, white, grey color palette, minimal and professional look)
Use grid system, consistent typography, soft shadows, rounded cards, professional UI components, and responsive layout

acceptanceCriteria: All pages use navy blue as primary color for headers and key elements
Light blue is used for accents, hover states, and secondary actions
White is used for card backgrounds and content areas
Very light grey is used for page backgrounds
Typography uses Poppins or Inter font family throughout
All buttons have rounded corners and subtle box shadows
Cards have soft shadows and rounded corners
Layout is responsive and works on desktop, tablet, and mobile
Grid system provides consistent spacing and alignment
Overall design feels modern, clean, and professional

constraints: Use Internet Identity for authentication instead of traditional email/password login
All data must be persisted in Motoko backend stable storage
Frontend must be built with React, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS
Do not modify read-only UI component sources in frontend/src/components/ui
PDF generation must happen on the frontend using client-side libraries
All five paper variants (Sets A-E) must be generated simultaneously during paper creation
nonGoals: Integration with external LMS or grading systems
Plagiarism detection or question similarity checking
Question import from external sources or file uploads
